data.name: incomingemail_dirman_description
data.value:
The Microsoft SharePoint Directory Management Service connects SharePoint sites to your organization's user directory in order to provide enhanced e-mail features. This service provides support for the creation and management of e-mail distribution groups from SharePoint sites. This service also creates contacts in your organization's user directory allowing people to find e-mail enabled SharePoint lists in their address book.

To use the Directory Management Service you need to provide the SharePoint Central Administration application pool account with write access to the container you specify in the Active Directory. Alternatively you can configure this server farm to use a remote SharePoint Directory Management Web Service.

data.name: incomingemail_DirManEnabled_label
data.value: Use the SharePoint Directory Management Service to create distribution groups and contacts?

data.name: incomingemail_DirManEnabledNo_Title
data.value: Use the SharePoint Directory Management Service to create distribution groups and contacts : No

data.name: incomingemail_DirManEnabledYes_Title
data.value: Use the SharePoint Directory Management Service to create distribution groups and contacts : Yes

data.name: incomingemail_DirManEnabledRemote_Title
data.value: Use the SharePoint Directory Management Service to create distribution groups and contacts : Use Remote

data.name: incomingemail_DirManSupportsDLs_label
data.value: Allow creation of distribution groups from SharePoint sites?

data.name: incomingemail_DirManSupportsDLsFalse_Title
data.value: Allow creation of distribution groups from SharePoint sites : No

data.name: incomingemail_DirManSupportsDLsTrue_Title
data.value: Allow creation of distribution groups from SharePoint sites : Yes

data.name: incomingemail_IPRestrictionOn_text
data.value: Accept mail from these safe e-mail servers:

data.name: incomingemail_IPRestrictionOff_text
data.value: Accept mail from all e-mail servers

data.name: incomingemail_TxtDirManUrl_invalid_error
data.value: The value specified for the Directory Management Service URL is not valid.

data.name: incomingemail_displayaddress_description1
data.value: Specify the e-mail server address that will be displayed in web pages when users create an incoming e-mail address for a site, list, or group.

data.name: incomingemail_displayaddress_description2
data.value: This setting is often used in conjunction with the Microsoft SharePoint Directory Management Web Service to provide a more friendly e-mail server address for users to type.

data.name: incomingemail_dropfolder_description
data.value:
Microsoft SharePoint Foundation checks periodically for incoming e-mail messages from the SMTP service. This setting specifies the folder in which to look for e-mail messages. When incoming e-mail settings are set to automatic mode, the e-mail drop folder is set automatically to the folder specified by the SMTP service.

Note: When incoming e-mail settings are set to advanced mode you need to ensure that the log on account for the Windows service 'WSS_LONG_NAME Timer' has modify permissions on the e-mail drop folder.

data.name: incomingemail_enable_description
data.value:
If enabled, SharePoint sites can receive e-mail and store incoming messages in lists. Sites, lists, and groups will need to be configured individually with their own e-mail addresses.

In automatic mode, all required settings are retrieved automatically. Advanced mode is necessary only if you are not using the SMTP service to receive incoming e-mail. When using advanced mode, you need to specify the e-mail drop folder.

data.name: incomingemail_IncomingEmail_label

data.name: incomingemail_safeservers_description
data.value: Specify whether to restrict the set of e-mail servers that can route mail directly to this server farm. This setting can help ensure the authenticity of e-mail stored in SharePoint sites. Enter one IP address per line in the format "11.22.33.44" or "11.22.33.44, 255.255.0.0".

data.name: Authentication_ClientIntegrationSectionDescription
data.value: Disabling client integration will remove features which launch client applications. Some authentication mechanisms (such as Forms) don't work well with client applications. In this configuration, users will either have to use browser-based editors to edit their documents or work on them locally and upload changes. Note: If client integration is turned on in conjunction with Forms mode, anonymous access should also be turned on or Forms aware client applications may fail to authenticate correctly.

data.name: Authentication_AnonymousSectionDescription
data.value: You can enable anonymous access for sites on this server or disallow anonymous access for all sites. Enabling anonymous access allows site administrators to turn anonymous access on. Disabling anonymous access blocks anonymous users in the web.config file for this zone. Note: If anonymous access is turned off when using Forms authentication mode, Forms aware client applications may fail to authenticate correctly.

data.name: Authentication_ClientServicePermSectionDescription
data.value: You can require that the user must have the Use Remote Interfaces permission in order to use the Client Object Model to access the server. The Client Object Model is used by some parts of the UI. Enabling this prevents users from performing some tasks using the UI if they do not have the Use Remote Interfaces permission.

data.name: jobedit_schedule_desc
data.value: Use this section to modify the schedule specifying when the timer job will run. Daily, weekly, and monthly schedules also include a window of execution. The timer service will pick a random time within this interval to begin executing the job on each applicable server. This feature is appropriate for high-load jobs which run on multiple servers on the farm. Running this type of job on all the servers simultaneously might place an unreasonable load on the farm. To specify an exact starting time, set the beginning and ending times of the interval to the same value.

data.name: vsgeneralsettings_bfh_desc
data.value: Specifies whether additional security headers are added to documents served to web browsers. These headers specify that a browser should show a download prompt for certain types of files (for example, .html) and to use the server's specified MIME type for other types of files.

data.name: vsgeneralsettings_bfh_permissive_desc
data.value: Specifies no headers are added, which provides a more compatible user experience.

data.name: vsgeneralsettings_bfh_strict_desc
data.value: Adds headers that force the browser to download certain types of files. The forced download improves security for the server by disallowing the automatic execution of Web content that contributors upload.

data.name: vsgeneralsettings_canary_desc
data.value: Security validations expire after a configurable amount of time, requiring the user to retry his operation.

data.name: vsgeneralsettings_events_desc
data.value: Turn on or off backward-compatible event handlers for this Web application. If this is turned off, users cannot bind document libraries to backward-compatible event handlers.

data.name: vsgeneralsettings_throttle_desc
data.value: Turn on or off the HTTP request throttling job. This job monitors front-end Web server performance, and in the event of HTTP request overload, rejects (throttles) low priority requests. You can turn request throttling off to allow services such as Search to run uninterrupted on the farm, however, in an unthrottled farm experiencing overload, front-end Web servers become less responsive, and may stop working.

data.name: metrics_improvement_desc1

data.name: metrics_error_desc1
data.value: Each time an error occurs, SharePoint can generate an error report to send to Microsoft. Microsoft uses these error reports to help understand the problems you are having and to help us improve our software. Error reports do not intentionally include any personal information, and if personal information is present Microsoft will not use it to identify or contact you. If you enable Microsoft Error Reporting for SharePoint, Microsoft will collect error reports and also periodically download a file to your SharePoint server that helps identify system problems.

data.name: metrics_improvement_desc2
data.value: Click here to review the privacy and server impact information related to these options.

data.name: metrics_script_error

data.name: metrics_error_silent

data.name: metrics_error_ignore

data.name: farmconfigurationwizard_welcomebody
data.value: How do you want to configure your SharePoint farm?

data.value: You can launch this wizard again from the Configuration Wizards page in the Central Administration site.

data.name: farmconfigurationwizard_ceip_title
data.value: Do you want to help make SharePoint better?

data.name: farmconfigurationwizard_ceip_description
data.value: You can help make SharePoint better by signing up for the Customer Experience Improvement Program and automatically sending error reports to Microsoft.

data.name: farmconfigurationwizard_ceip_choose_title
data.value: Sign up for the Customer Experience Improvement Program and automatically upload error reports to Microsoft

data.name: farmconfigurationwizard_ceip_choose_yes
data.value: Yes, I am willing to participate (Recommended).

data.name: farmconfigurationwizard_ceip_choose_no
data.value: No, I don't wish to participate.

data.name: farmconfigurationwizard_ceip_detail_description
data.value: This program collects information about computer hardware and how you use SharePoint without interrupting you or your users. This helps Microsoft identify which SharePoint features to improve. No information collected is used to identify or contact you or your users.

data.name: farmconfigurationwizard_ceip_error_reporting_description1
data.value: Each time an error occurs, SharePoint can generate an error report to send to Microsoft. Microsoft uses these error reports to help understand the problems you are having and to help us improve our software. Error reports do not intentionally include any personal information, and if personal information is present Microsoft will not use it to identify or contact you. If you enable Microsoft Error Reporting for SharePoint, Microsoft will collect error reports and also periodically download a file to your SharePoint server that helps identify system problems.

data.name: farmconfigurationwizard_ceip_error_reporting_description2
data.value: If you choose to enable Error Reporting using this wizard, Microsoft will automatically collect server error reports and client machine script error reports. You can change your Error Reporting settings later in the Privacy Options section of Central Administration. For instance, you can configure Error Reporting to collect SharePoint server errors only and not client machine script errors. You can also configure Error Reporting to ask for permission before sending error reports to Microsoft.

data.name: farmconfigurationwizard_welcomejoinbody

data.name: userSolutions_loadBalancing_desc
data.value: Specify how execution of code in sandboxed solutions is distributed across servers.

data.name: userSolutions_loadBalancing_local
data.value: All sandboxed code runs on the same machine as a request.

data.name: userSolutions_loadBalancing_local_desc
data.value: Requests to run sandboxed code are run on the same server as web requests. This will perform better, but may not support high numbers of unique solutions. All web front ends must have the Sanboxed Code Service running.

data.name: userSolutions_loadBalancing_remote
data.value: Requests to run sandboxed code are routed by solution affinity.

data.name: userSolutions_loadBalancing_remote_desc
data.value: Requests to run sandboxed code are run on available servers with the Sandboxed Code Service. This uses solution affinity to organize which servers run sandboxed code, so you can independently organize resources for sandboxed code.

data.name: userSolutions_restrictions_desc1
data.value: You can block certain solutions from running within sites in this farm. To block a solution, use the browse button to select and upload it. You can optionally specify a message users of the solution will receive.

data.name: userSolutions_restrictions_desc2
data.value: Warning: Solution blocking is performed based on the contents of the solution file. Solution packages that have the same name but different contents are treated as different solutions.

data.name: identityprovider_sectiondesc1
data.value: Negotiate (Kerberos) is the recommended security configuration to use with Windows authentication. If this option is selected and Kerberos is not configured, NTLM will be used. For Kerberos, the application pool account needs to be Network Service or an account that has been configured by the domain administrator. NTLM authentication will work with any application pool account and with the default domain configuration.
